javadoc:
DataBuffer provides an array like interface into a set of Data
 at a specific index.  Data can be retrieved by using a positive
 offset from the current position.  The purpose of this class is to
 provide an opaque storage mechanism for Data that is made up of other
 Data items.

 This interface does not provide methods to reposition the data item
 buffer.  This is so that it is clear that methods accepeting this
 base class are not to mess which the base Address for this object.

methods.name: getData
methods.comment: Get one Data item from the buffer at the current position plus offset.

params.name: offset
params.comment: the displacement from the current position.

return.comment: the Data item at offset from the current position.

methods.name: getDataAfter
methods.comment: Get the next data item starting after offset.

return.comment: Data item starting after this offset

methods.name: getDataBefore
methods.comment: Get the previous data item starting before offset.

return.comment: Data item starting before this offset

methods.name: getNextOffset
methods.comment: Get the offset to the next data item found after offset.

return.comment: offset of the first data item existing after this one.

methods.name: getPreviousOffset
methods.comment: Get the offset to the previous data item existing before this offset.

return.comment: offset of the first data item existing before this one.

methods.name: getData
methods.comment:
Get an array of data items that begin at or after start up to end.
   Data items that exist before start are not returned
   Data items that exist before end, but terminate after end ARE returned

return.comment: array of CodeDatas that exist between start and end.

methods.javadoc:
Get the Address which corresponds to the offset 0.
@return the current address of offset 0.
methods.name: getAddress
methods.comment: Get the Address which corresponds to the offset 0.
